definition: to walk/to step/pace/traveling (walking with the ball, a foul in basketball)
to walk/to go/to run/to move (of vehicle)/to visit/to leave/to go away/to die (euph.)/from/through/away (in compound verbs, such as 撤走[che4 zou3])/to change (shape, form, meaning)
a step/a pace/walk/march/stages in a process/situation

sentences.english: Ask friends or family members to hit the road with you.
sentences.chinese: 请朋友或家人和你一起参加走步运动。

sentences.english: Nope, the best brain sharpener may be … sneakers?Yup.
sentences.chinese: 不，使大脑聪慧的最佳砺石或许要数走步。

sentences.english: Generally, there is a step counter on a walking machine to show how many kilometers you've walked.
sentences.chinese: 走步机上一般都有计步表可以计算你走的公里数。

sentences.english: The scene is lit only by the light of a torch swinging with his steps.
sentences.chinese: 只有一盏因走步而晃动的手电筒灯光，照明这个场景。

definition: to receive a served ball (volleyball, tennis etc)/to catch a ball thrown by sb
to scout for a tour operator/to reconnoiter a potential tour itinerary/(tennis) to commit a foot fault
to break the rules/an illegality/a foul
golden rooster stands on one leg (tai chi posture)/standing on one leg
to run up (pole vault, javelin, bowling etc)/approach/run-up/(aviation) takeoff run
